title: Stafford wins first MVP, says he'll return in '26
content: Rams QB Matthew Stafford edged Drake Maye in the closest MVP vote since 2003, then closed his acceptance speech by saying he'll return to play next season.

title: Brees, Fitzgerald make Hall of Fame in first year
content: The Pro Football Hall of Fame will welcome five into its 2026 class, including Drew Brees and Larry Fitzgerald -- who were in their first year of eligibility -- as well as Adam Vinatieri, Luke Kuechly and Roger Craig.

title: Cowboys picked to play in NFL's first game in Rio
content: The Cowboys will play in the NFL's first regular-season game in Rio de Janeiro against a TBD opponent at historic Maracana Stadium.

title: Jets DT Phillips: Glenn inherited 'cancerous' group
content: Jets DT Harrison Phillips said it has been difficult for the team to get over the franchise's losing culture, saying first-year coach Aaron Glenn inherited a "cancerous" group.

title: Sources: Thomas free agent after Nets cut him
content: The Nets released guard Cam Thomas, allowing him to enter free agency and sign with any other team, sources told ESPN.

title: Doc: Clase accused of rigged pitches in 48 games
content: Cleveland Guardians pitcher Emmanuel Clase is accused of throwing suspect pitches to benefit bettors in at least 48 games over two years, significantly more than was initially revealed by prosecutors, according to a court document.

title: Trump signs law that withholds U.S. WADA dues
content: A provision for the U.S. to withhold its annual dues to WADA is now law until the organization takes steps to address the country's accusations that it's beholden to Chinese influence.

title: Bulls aim to exit NBA's 'middle' with busy deadline
content: After an uncommonly active trade deadline, Bulls VP Arturas Karnisovas said the franchise is "not satisfied" with being mediocre in a shift in tone from previous years.

title: Sources: Eyeing NCAA return, Bailey to visit GCU
content: Amari Bailey, who is seeking to become the first player to return to college basketball after playing in NBA games, has set up his first official recruiting visit to Grand Canyon University, sources told ESPN.

title: ü•á Faces of the Games: U.S. Olympians to watch
content: On Friday, the 2026 Milan Cortina Olympics will kick off. From Lindsey Vonn to Amber Glenn, here are the athletes you'll want to know.

title: Making sense of NBA trade deadline week: We picked the real winners and losers
content: After a wild week of superstar movement, Zach Kram unveils his winners and losers of the NBA trade deadline.

title: Barnwell‚Äôs annual Super Bowl opus: We size up every facet of Seahawks-Patriots and pick the winner

title: How Laila Edwards carved her own path as USA Hockey's first Black player
content: Laila Edwards, a standout at Wisconsin, is ready for her Olympic debut as USA Hockey's first Black player.

title: Who you calling old? At the 2026 Olympics, age is just a number
content: Lindsey Vonn, Nick Goepper, Gus Kenworthy and Maddy Schaffrick are in their golden years at the 2026 Olympics. Just don't call them old.

title: Women's Power Rankings: Can Texas exact revenge and snap LSU's win streak?
content: The Tigers seek to sweep a key series in the SEC, but the Longhorns look to avenge their loss in Baton Rouge from last month.

title: No Spanish? No problem: Bad Bunny promises a party at halftime
content: Ahead of Sunday's halftime show, Bad Bunny reassured fans that his performance is meant to be felt, not translated.

title: Super Bowl LX: Seahawks-Patriots marks latest rematch in big game
content: This year marks the 10th different repeat Super Bowl matchup and the fourth in which the Patriots are involved.

title: Wetzel: Standing on the brink of anything-goes NCAA eligibility
content: By not controlling who is eligible, the NCAA is losing the ability to function as an organizing athletic body.

title: NHL Awards Watch: Kucherov gaining on MacKinnon for MVP?
content: We polled PHWA voters to find out who's ahead in the major races as some new names have entered the conversation for the Hart and Vezina.

title: Olney and Passan's MLB offseason lessons -- and what they mean for baseball's future
content: From more outrage over MLB's top spenders to what to make of deals that never happened, here's what we learned this winter.

title: High school stories of 11 Super Bowl stars -- and two coaches
content: Find out what Sam Darnold, Drake Maye, Cooper Kupp, TreVeyon Henderson and others were like before the NFL.

title: Sixty bets for Super Bowl LX
content: We navigated the thousands of bets being offered for Super Bowl LX and narrowed it down to our 60 favorite from 10 different categories.

title: Super Bowl LX betting buzz: Bettor places $1,000 MVP wagers on Super Bowl kickers
content: Multiple sportsbooks have reported taking MVP wagers on longshots, including a variety of Seahawks defenders.

title: Wrexham have Premier League in sight, just five years after Reynolds and Mac takeover
content: Feb. 9 marks five years since Ryan Reynolds and Rob Mac completed their Wrexham takeover and already, they're on track for promotion to the Premier League.

title: NBA Power Rankings: Where all 30 teams stack up ahead of trade deadline
content: Which players are under the most pressure and where all 30 teams rank a day before the Thursday trade deadline.

title: Road to $1M paydays: How WNBA salaries evolved with each CBA
content: For the first time, a $1 million base salary is expected in the new WNBA CBA, and the cap could see a 230% increase.

title: 12 teams that improved their 2026 CFP chances with their roster moves
content: With signing day closing many team's personnel moves, we look at the teams ready to make long postseason runs.

title: From AD and Harden to Zubac and Vucevic: Fantasy reaction to the latest NBA trades
content: Andre Snellings and Eric Moody provide fantasy reactions as trades go down leading up to Thursday's NBA trade deadline.

title: Men's boxing pound-for-pound rankings: Stevenson moves up, shakes up the top 10
content: Shakur Stevenson's victory over Teofimo Lopez Jr. vaulted him up the list, but just how high did he climb? Here are the latest ESPN pound-for-pound rankings.

title: Kerala actor Maniyanpillai Raju involved in hit-and-run; two youths on motorcycle injured
content: Police register case for rash driving and failure to ensure medical assistance to the injured. The incident occurred near Trivandrum Club in Thiruvananthapuram city late Thursday

title: Adani Foundation marks one year of Mangal Seva programme
content: The programme supports divyang women through financial assistance, a statement issued by the Adani Group stated

title: Healthcare industry needs to functionally readjust to meet challenges posed by climate change: Experts
content: Healthcare delivery systems contribute substantially to carbon emissions through resource-intense operations and high energy use, the conference found

title: APJAC Amaravati seeks official recognition, passes 16 resolutions at State conference
content: It demands appointment of a PRC Commissioner, announcement of Interim Relief and a clear roadmap for settling pending arrears

title: Tiger tale: Life in the territory of fear in Andhra Pradesh
content: The ongoing human-animal conflict in Andhra Pradesh, where a sub-adult male tiger killed 20 heads of cattle in East Godavari and Eluru districts, has upended the livelihoods of many tobacco growers, dairy farmers and agricultural workers. Nellore Sravani writes about the panic prevailing among the people and the Forest department‚Äôs race to find out why an apparently healthy tiger is killing livestock in human habitats

title: Global navies to gather in Visakhapatnam for International Fleet Review and MILAN 2026
content: Visakhapatnam will host a slate of major maritime events in February, bringing global navies to India‚Äôs east coast

title: Tejashwi slams government, Nitish calls him child; Jan Suraaj Party moves SC over cash inducement to women voters in Bihar poll
content: While slamming the NDA government in Bihar under Chief Minister Nitish Kumar, Tejashwi Yadav charged that it was running on ‚Äúfalse praise and complete negligence‚Äù

title: Transplanted lives: Organ donation in Kerala gains traction
content: Organ donation from live donors and harvested from brain-dead patients is often mired in controversies and misconceptions. Aathira Haridas meets some of the organ recipients and donors to understand the complex emotional and medical aspects of the life-saving process, which is slowly gaining ground in the State

title: The Lighthouse Bar opens at The Park Visakhapatnam
content: The Lighthouse Bar at The Park returns to a familiar address in the city with quiet confidence and sharp flavours

title: Migrant hands rooted across Telangana‚Äôs farms
content: From grape farms on Hyderabad‚Äôs fringes to paddy fields deep in the countryside, Telangana‚Äôs agriculture is being sustained by workers from other States. Farmers, activists and government officials say the migrants have become indispensable to farm operations here even as local youth step away from fieldwork. K. Shiva Shanker¬†traces the forces reshaping farm labour in the State

title: Classic case of consensual relationship turning acrimonious: Supreme Court quashes FIR alleging rape
content: The bench delivered its verdict on an appeal challenging a March last year order of the Chhattisgarh High Court that had refused to quash the proceedings arising out of the FIR registered in Bilaspur district in February 2025

title: Shrinking shock absorbers of Bannerghatta National Park in Bengaluru
content: Instead of maintaining the ESZ whose main objective is to function as a buffer for protected areas, successive governments have worked at reducing the ESZ around the Bannerghatta National Park in south Bengaluru. Hemanth C.S. looks at the implications

title: Loud music may damage your hearing before you realise it
content: Research has shown that prolonged exposure to loud noise can damage synapses without affecting the hearing threshold; since clinical assessments bank on this threshold, a normal audiogram need not mean no hearing damage

title: Death by cyberchondria
content: Filicide by a mother of two in Rajasthan‚Äôs Bhilwara district has shown the extremes to which health misinformation amplified by social media algorithms can lead in a country especially vulnerable to spurious medical advice

title: ED arrests former Resolution Professional of Richa Industries Limited
content: The accused, identified as Arvind Kumar, worked the company‚Äôs Resolution Professional from December 2018 to June 2025

title: Rediscovering the virtues of bamboo, an ancient plant
content: Bamboo trees across the country are best planted and grown in tropical and humid conditions, with good sunlight exposure and soil rich in organic matter

title: Odisha proposes changes to English spelling of six districts
content: Spellings of Deogarh, Khordha, Balasore, Kendrapara, Keonjhar and Nayagarh districts are likely to be changed to Debagarh, Khoradha, Baleshwar, Kendrapada, Kendujhar and Nayagada

title: Haryana MBBS students in dilemma over government‚Äôs bond policy; seek clarity on various aspects before consent
content: The policy to incentivise doctors to opt for government service upon completion of MBBS degree from government and government-aided medical colleges in Haryana was notified in 2022 and is applicable from academic session 2020-21 onwards

title: How the two-language policy impacted the teachers of other languages in 1968
content: On January 23, 1968, the first¬†DMK¬†government, headed by¬†C.N.¬†Annadurai, adopted a resolution in the Madras Assembly scrapping the three-language formula¬†and mandating the teaching of only Tamil and English. The immediate switchover affected over 4,000 Hindi and Sanskrit teachers at about 2,400 schools in the State

title: Documents on anti-Hindi agitation wiped out on¬† Bhaktavatsalam‚Äôs¬†order
content: On February 24, 1967, a month before losing power to the¬†DMK, the last Congress Chief Minister ordered the Public Department to destroy records¬†on the anti-Hindi agitation that rocked the State. After assuming office,¬†Annadurai¬†sought an explanation from the Chief Secretary and wanted to know whether the papers could be reconstructed

title: Several people arrested, detained at liquor party near Ahmedabad
content: The action followed a raid conducted shortly after midnight at Safal Nirvana Greens near Sanand, where a Mumbai-based man had organised a party to mark his brother-in-law‚Äôs 25th wedding anniversary, officials said

title: Uttar Pradesh CM orders State-wide campaign, action against Chinese kite string
content: ‚ÄúChinese kite string is completely banned and its continued availability is a matter of serious concern. All police officials across the State should launch intensive raid operations,‚Äù Mr. Adityanath said

title: Mysuru‚Äôs Mylari dosa launches in Bengaluru drawing crowds, and the Chief Minister
content: Mysuru‚Äôs ‚ÄòOld Original‚Äô¬†Vinayaka Mylari dosa‚Äôs Bengaluru restaurant, inaugurated by Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, is drawing a long line of customers. We join them to try the signature soft masala dosa with white butter and green sagu

title: Orissa HC directs to stop movement of illegally raised minerals
content: Odisha government has been directed to file an affidavit on actions taken to contain illegal mining activities within three weeks

title: TRAI issues Telecommunication (Broadcasting and Cable) Services Interconnection (Addressable Systems) (Seventh Amendment) Regulations, 2026
content: Clearly defined timelines for audits; Audit is to be done on financial year basis in place of calendar year; and Broadcasters can depute their representative during audit to ensure transparency and credibility of the audit process, among the main features of the regulations

title: FIR over scuffle in BHU campus as UGC issue take centre stage
content: A physical altercation at Banaras Hindu University (BHU) on February 3, 2026, occurred after M.A. History student Adarsh Kumar reported being attacked for sharing a protest poster on new UGC regulations. While the FIR does not explicitly connect the violence to the UGC issue, he claims it stemmed from a WhatsApp debate on the topic

title: Congress appoints former CM Okram Ibobi Singh as its Manipur unit chief
content: The party appointed Meghachandra as the new Congress Legislature Party Leader with K. Ranjit Singh as his deputy

title: UT with Assembly model should be done away with from Constitution: J&K CM Omar Abdullah
content: ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs very hard to work as CM of a UT with Assembly. I appeal to the Prime Minister to as a gift to this nation abolish this system from the Constitution. Either it should be a State or a UT without Assembly. It‚Äôs like tying the hand of government from behind and is a fraud with the mandate of people,‚Äù said Mr. Abdullah

title: Amit Shah embarks on two-day J&K visit
content: Senior Congress leader and legislator Tariq Hameed Karra said frequent visits by Amit Shah were ‚Äúan indication of the fact that things were not normal in J&K‚Äù

title: Reduction in air pollution isn‚Äôt a victory, but a positive sign
content: Development and employment in NCR, home to eight crore people, must be balanced with the need for clean air, says Central pollution panel official Tarun Kumar Pithode

title: SC tells Bengal govt. to pay 25% DA by March 31
content: Leader of Opposition¬†Suvendu¬†Adhikari called court verdict a ‚Äòdefeat‚Äô for Mamata Banerjee and ‚Äòmajor win‚Äô for government employees

title: T.N.‚Äôs first glow garden opens at Mamallapuram
content: An amphitheatre, food kiosks, selfie points, walkways lined with artificial trees, plants and flowers, and seats that light up are among the features of the garden that has come up on¬†TTDC¬†land

title: TMC¬†govt. hikes monthly aid for women, unveils scheme for unemployed
content: ‚Çπ4.06-lakh-crore¬†interim budget tabled ahead of West Bengal Assembly election; under ‚ÄòBanglar¬†Yuba¬†Sathi‚Äô, monthly allowance of ‚Çπ1,500 will be given to jobless youth;¬†BJP¬†terms it a ‚Äòdeception‚Äô

title: Maoist killed, C-60 commando injured in encounter in Gadchiroli; two Maoist camps destroyed
content: The operation involving 14 C-60 units under SDPO Bhamragd began near Phodewada village on the Gadchiroli-Narayanpur border after specific intelligence was received on the evening of February 3, about the presence of ultras of company number 10 of the outlawed Communist Party of India (Maoist), an official said

title: Opposition slams Tamil Nadu Agriculture Minister‚Äôs remarks on North Indian migrant workers
content: ‚ÄòNorth Indians come to Tamil Nadu only to sell panipuri, work in construction (sector), and wipe tables‚Äô, says Tamil Nadu Agriculture Minister M.R.K. Panneerselvam; AIADMK, BJP slam Minister; DMK defends him

title: Between 2019 and 2025, nearly 28% of road accident victims in Karnataka were pedestrians: CJ Vibhu Bakhru
content: e-DAR, an online system aimed at faster, more efficient reporting and processing of road accident cases, was inaugurated in Karnataka

title: India‚Äôs strategic future lies in universities, innovation hubs, says  IGCAR former Director
content: Young Researchers‚Äô Conclave features Young Scientists‚Äô sessions and live demonstrations and advanced rocket kit launches

title: Cabinet clears AI-powered software to identify hate speech, misinformation and malicious campaigns
content: Patil says there will be no human interference in this, and that no party or government will benefit

title: Supreme Court upholds Telangana High Court decision that free allotment of land to IAMC is ‚Äòunsustainable‚Äô
content: The top court dismisses petition filed by International Arbitration & Mediation Centre and agreed with the High Court that gratuitous distribution of natural resources was both ‚Äúunsustainable and contrary to the procedure‚Äù

title: UPSC expands conditions for attempting CSEs after being allotted for IPS, Group A Services
content: Face authentication of candidates at exam venues, live photo capture during form filling made mandatory; many point out notification riddled with spelling mistakes

title: Government says 2,645 posts vacant at AAI, 3 aviation regulators
content: In a separate written reply, Mr. Mohol said that a total of 6,936 flights were cancelled by IndiGo during the last three months affecting 10,81,680 passengers

title: Sri Lankan diplomat lauds Indian government, people for relief efforts following Cyclone Ditwah
content: He also refers to the Sri Lankan government‚Äôs commitment to relief, rehabilitation, and climate-resilient development after the cyclone

title: Rajya Sabha adopts the Motion of Thanks amid protests by Opposition
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) MP Priyanka Chaturvedi says even EAM had been unaware of the details of the trade deal; BJP MP Maya Naroliya says under the Modi government, the allocation to agriculture sector increased

title: Congress takes out march to condemn Union government for diluting MGNREGA
content: While speaking at a meeting, TNCC president K. Selvaperunthagai says leaders, including Leader of the Opposition in the Lok Sabha Rahul Gandhi and Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge, have expressed concerns about the dilution of MGNREGA, both inside and outside Parliament

title: Congress flags ‚Äòprocedural irregularities‚Äô in Lok Sabha
content: Rules of Procedure make it mandatory for PM to explain government‚Äôs position at the end of the debate or inform the House of his inability to do so, says Congress; seeks Speaker‚Äôs explanation

title: NHRC issues notice over allegations of exploitation, forced religious conversion of women at gyms
content: The Commission directs Chief Secretaries of States, Union Territories to form guidelines/policy/registration norms and standards for such establishments

title: No takers for ‚Çπ57-lakh truss work at Mundamveli apartments
content: The truss installation was cleared after a three-member panel, including an expert from IIT Madras, conducted a structural stability analysis in August 2025

title: SRM University-A.P. invites applications for M.Tech courses, deadline February 15
content: Candidates can submit their applications forms by visiting  the official werbsite  https://applications.srmap.edu.in/m-tech

title: Underpass connecting NH 66 and Baikampady Industrial Area to be built soon, says NHAI
content: Deputy Commissioner H. V. Darshan directs NHAI to complete 24 road safety works in consultation with traffic police by March-end

title: Kuki-Zo groups boycott tribal MLAs in Manipur government, accuse them of ‚Äòbetrayal‚Äô
content: The Kuki-Zo Council said that by joining a Meitei-dominated government, the Kuki-Zo MLAs have disregarded the pain and sacrifices endured by the community during the ethnic conflict

title: Court cannot examine correctness of route for metro line, says Karnataka HC
content: However, court asks authorities to examine concern of property owners and business establishments of Nagarbhavi

title: Experts prepare to tranquilise tiger after second cattle kill
content: Pune-based RESQ experts joined the monitoring exercise and Hyderabad-based HyTICOs experts will join the operation on Friday; The tiger moved along the borders of Konaseema, Kakinada by Thursday night

title: V.S. Achuthanandan‚Äô s son says CPI(M) will decide whether or not to accept Padma Vibhushan
content: The party V.S. Achuthanandan represented¬†has a clear stance on accepting official¬†honours. As a communist, he held such values and the party‚Äôs decisions closely. So the family‚Äôs decision on accepting the¬†honour¬†will be in tandem with the CPI(M)‚Äôs position on the matter, says Arun Kumar

title: High Court quashes order on Group-1 revaluation; brings relief to 563 appointees
content: The Division Bench rejected the single bench order and allowed the appeals filed by the selected candidates for their continuation in the long-pending recruitment process for 563 Group-1 posts in the State.

title: Efficient water management will ensure a drought-free State: Naidu
content: Water Users' Associations play a key role in water governance, works will be allotted to irrigation associations without GST, while allowing them to collect water tax and manage canals efficiently, says Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu

title: Meghalaya coal mine explosion LIVE: CM warns of strict action, deputes 2 Ministers to assess situation
content: The Chief Minister announced an ex gratia of ‚Çπ3 lakh each from the state government to the next of kin of those who lost their lives in the incident

title: Overall funding dips, but investor interest rises in early stage start-ups in Karnataka: Report
content: In terms of the total capital raised, Karnataka, at $3.8 billion in 2025, remained ahead of its peers

title: Punjab: AAP leader Lucky Oberoi shot dead outside gurdwara
content: Aam Aadmi Party functionary Lucky Oberoi was shot dead outside a gurdwara in Jalandhar's Model Town area early Friday morning. The attack occurred while Oberoi was inside his Thar vehicle, with initial reports indicating four to five rounds were fired. The incident is currently under investigation.

title: Impact of US sanctions: India import of Russian crude in Dec lowest since Feb 2025
content: The US had announced sanctions on the two companies on Oct 22 and set Nov 21 as the deadline for all dealings with them to be wound down. As per data shared by the ministry of commerce and industry, Dec supplies of Russian oil were nearly 27% lower compared with imports worth $3.7 billion a month earlier in Nov 2025, and over 15% lower than the $3.2 billion imported during the corresponding month in 2024.

title: Ghaziabad sisters' suicide: 'They wanted to become Korean,' says father
content: Three sisters in Ghaziabad allegedly died by suicide, with preliminary findings suggesting heavy influence from Korean online content and games. Their father acknowledged financial stress but denied it as a cause, stating the girls lived in a fantasy world. Neighbors noted the sisters' isolation and lack of interaction, with their schooling being irregular and academic performance below average.

title: ‚ÄòShe has gone through a lot‚Äô: Patil dedicates RCB‚Äôs WPL triumph to Smriti Mandhana
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru secured their second Women's Premier League championship. They defeated Delhi Capitals in a thrilling final on Thursday. Captain Smriti Mandhana played a pivotal role with a remarkable innings. This victory marks a significant achievement for the team. The win also holds personal significance for the captain and the team.

title: Amazon layoffs: Company to cut thousands of jobs as it closes Fresh stores
content: Amazon is closing approximately 60 Amazon Fresh stores nationwide, impacting thousands of jobs after a six-year effort. Affected employees are offered severance pay or transfer opportunities to other Amazon-owned businesses like Whole Foods. The company cited struggles with the economic model and customer experience for Fresh and Go stores, contrasting with Whole Foods' growth.

title: 'No cash, take my radish': Farmer protests 'bribe' demand over pending farm road in Karnataka
content: A farmer's unique protest in Bengaluru, using radishes to highlight alleged bribery demands by revenue officials, has brought attention to stalled civic work. Prasanna Kumar staged his demonstration after a Lokayukta order for a farm approach road remained unfulfilled for months. He claims officials sought money, offering his produce as an alternative to payment.

title: ‚ÄòEe sala cup namdu‚Äô: Mandhana hails ‚Äò3 titles in 3 years‚Äô as RCB‚Äôs golden run continues
content: Smriti Mandhana led Royal Challengers Bengaluru to their second WPL title, defeating Delhi Capitals by six wickets.  Mandhana praised the team's belief and the support staff's clarity, dedicating the win to the passionate RCB fanbase.  Georgia Voll's aggressive batting and Lauren Bell's bowling were crucial in the successful chase of 204.

title: $2 trillion wiped off crypto markets! Bitcoin down 46% since October 2025
content: Bitcoin has experienced significant losses, dropping over 20% since early 2026 and losing nearly half its value since its October peak. This decline, exacerbated by concerns over Federal Reserve policy and tech sector weakness, has impacted companies holding digital assets and erased gains since Trump's election.

title: Google CEO thinks bloodbath in markets in reaction to Anthropic is overblown
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai and Nvidia's Jensen Huang dismiss market panic over AI plugins, calling it overblown.  Anthropic's new tools, particularly for legal tasks, triggered significant stock drops.  Pichai views AI as an enabling tool, while Huang argues it will enhance, not replace, existing software, urging a focus on core competencies.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens in red ahead of RBI meet; BSE Sensex down 100 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in red ahead of the RBI monetary policy. While Nifty50 opened below 25,600, BSE Sensex was down over 100 points.

title: IndiGo‚Äôs December disruption stranded 16.2 lakh domestic flyers: DGCA
content: The directorate‚Äôs monthly traffic data for Dec 2025 says 16.2 lakh domestic flyers were stranded at airports across the country due to the non-availability of either IndiGo aircraft or their crew members. The number of people affected due to total cancellation of flights was 9.8 lakh, while those stranded at the airports due to delays beyond two hours were 6.4 lakh.

title: OpenAI sees exit of senior-level employees after CEO makes it compulsory to use ChatGPT
content: OpenAI is experiencing a significant exodus of senior researchers as CEO Sam Altman prioritizes ChatGPT development over long-term AI exploration.  Key figures, including a VP of research, have departed due to resource allocation disputes, with experimental projects reportedly sidelined.  This strategic shift, driven by intense competition, leaves some teams feeling marginalized and questioning their original research goals.

title: Savannah Guthrie‚Äôs missing mother: Family pleads for answers in new video
content: An 84-year-old woman, Nancy Guthrie, mother of "Today" show host Savannah Guthrie, remains missing after her suspected abduction from her Tucson home. Investigators are treating ransom notes demanding millions in bitcoin as credible, with deadlines set for Thursday and Monday. The family has pleaded for direct contact to confirm her well-being.

title: 'Every day can't be tukka': Rishabh Pant's explosive verdict on Abhishek Sharma
content: Rishabh Pant has identified Abhishek Sharma as cricket's most dangerous batter currently, praising his consistent, fearless approach and belief. Pant also shared insights from Rahul Dravid's advice on maintaining emotional balance, emphasizing the importance of remaining grounded whether scoring runs or failing. This perspective highlights the mental fortitude required for elite athletes.

title: Chor machaye shor: Caught stealing, thief files assault complaint against attackers in B'luru
content: An auto driver, caught stealing electrical equipment from a Bengaluru house, filed a police complaint claiming he was assaulted by residents. The homeowner also filed a counter-complaint, stating the trio attacked them with a beer bottle. Police have arrested the driver and his associates.

title: Bulls vs Raptors injury report: Who‚Äôs out, questionable, and starting Feb 5
content: Chicago Bulls and Toronto Raptors clash Thursday, both battling for Eastern Conference playoff spots amidst significant roster disruptions.  With key players sidelined due to trades and injuries, this game hinges on depth, rebounding, and guard play. The Bulls have dominated the season series, but Toronto's defense aims to challenge Chicago's depleted lineup.

title: Tyler Shough named NFL Rookie of the Year after standout Saints season
content: New Orleans Saints quarterback Tyler Shough has earned the Pepsi Zero Sugar NFL Rookie of the Year award. Stepping in mid-season, he revitalized the Saints' campaign, leading them to a winning record in their final nine games.

title: NHL prospect Gavin McKenna released on $20K bail after felony assault
content: Penn State forward and top 2026 NHL draft prospect Gavin McKenna was arrested on felony assault charges following an altercation near campus. McKenna, facing aggravated assault and other charges, was released on $20,000 bail. The incident reportedly involved McKenna punching a victim, causing facial injuries requiring surgery.

title: Married woman can‚Äôt claim rape on false marriage promise: Supreme Court
content: A bench of Justices B V Nagarathna and Ujjal Bhuyan said in such cases, a woman was not eligible to get married due to the subsistence of her marriage and she could not invoke the ground of false promise of marriage. It passed the order while quashing criminal proceedings against a lawyer on a complaint filed by a woman advocate alleging that he had raped her on the false promise of marriage.

title: Pir Panjal division demand a ‚ÄòGreater Kashmir conspiracy‚Äô? BJP MLA roils J&K assembly
content: The row comes weeks after PDP president Mehbooba Mufti pitched for a separate administrative division comprising Rajouri and Poonch in Pir Panjal along with Chenab valley districts, citing remoteness, hilly terrain and lack of infrastructure ‚Äî a demand BJP opposed. The region refers to the mountainous belt along the Pir Panjal range south of Kashmir valley and close to the LoC.

title: Manoj Bajpayee's 'Ghooskhor Pandat' lands in controversy: Legal notice sent to makers ‚Äî Here's why
content: Manoj Bajpayee's new film 'Ghooskhor Pandat' is already making waves, but not quite in the way the team expected. Following its announcement, the film has attracted a storm of criticism for its provocative title, prompting legal notices to Netflix and its director. Critics accuse the film of unfairly associating the Pandit community with unethical practices.

title: 5 LCA Mk1A fighter jets fully ready for delivery to IAF: HAL
content: HAL said that ‚Äúan additional nine aircraft have already been built and flown. Upon receipt of engines from General Electric (US company), these aircraft will be made ready for delivery‚Äù. ‚ÄúAll design and development issues identified are being addressed in an expedited manner. HAL is in active discussions with IAF to deliver the aircraft at the earliest,‚Äù it said in a statement.

title: Deals with EU, US good sign for world stability: PM Modi in Rajya Sabha
content: PM Modi‚Äôs remarks in Rajya Sabha, during the debate on the motion of thanks on the President‚Äôs address, came even as the treaty with the US is yet to be formally signed. It‚Äôs being seen as an indication that the two sides may have resolved their differences. The formal announcement of the deal is likely next week.

title: Police can‚Äôt arrest an accused simply to ask questions: Supreme Court
content: Enumerating various sections of the newly enacted Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita, 2023, a bench of Justices M M Sundresh and N K Singh said a notice under Section 35(3) of the law to an accused or any individual concerned, qua offences punishable with imprisonment of up to 7 years, is the rule.

title: 'Border 2' : Sunny Deol starrer races past Rs 294 crore amid declining numbers
content: Despite facing fluctuations in recent collections, 'Border 2' has managed to gather an impressive Rs 294 crore within India and an outstanding Rs 402 crore worldwide. Capitalizing on the Republic Day holiday, this gripping war drama, considered a spiritual continuation of the iconic 1997 film, features the dynamic Sunny Deol and a remarkable cast.

title: India may raise Zakir Naik issue again during PM‚Äôs Malaysia visit
content: India and Malaysia have an extradition treaty, but the case, as Malaysia maintains, will be resolved based on judicial consideration. The official said that Modi and his counterpart Anwar Ibrahim will review progress under the India-Malaysia Comprehensive Strategic Partnership, especially in priority areas of cooperation such as trade, investments, defence, security, semiconductors, digital technologies, renewable energy, education, healthcare, and people-to-people exchanges.

title: India, six Gulf nations set stage to launch FTA talks
content: Gulf Cooperation Council  ‚Äî comprising Bahrain, Kuwait, Oman, Qatar, Saudi Arabia and UAE ‚Äî is a key trade and investment partner for India, with exports of nearly $57 billion and imports of around $122 billion, accounting for over 15% of India‚Äôs total global trade. Trade with GCC has grown at an average annual rate of about 15% in the last five years.

title: In Rajya Sabha, Kharge refers to LS row, draws BJP fire
content: Kharge‚Äôs reference to LS proceedings drew a sharp response from BJP, with Leader of the House in RS JP Nadda mocking Rahul as ‚Äúabodh balak (ignorant child)‚Äù and reminding Kharge that events of one House cannot be debated in another. Nadda asked Kharge not to let Congress become ‚Äúhostage‚Äù to Rahul and said arrogance and ignorance should not dictate actions.

title: Open to exploring oil supplies from Venezuela: Govt
content: ‚ÄúConsistent with India‚Äôs approach to energy security, India remains open to exploring the commercial merits of any new crude supply options, including from Venezuela,‚Äù said the official. On India‚Äôs energy sourcing, the official recalled that govt had stated publicly on several occasions that ensuring the energy security of 1.4 billion Indians was the supreme priority of govt.

title: Is Cooper Flagg playing tonight vs Spurs? Latest Mavericks injury update
content: Dallas Mavericks' Cooper Flagg is set to play against the San Antonio Spurs on February 5, 2026, after clearing injury checks.  With Kyrie Irving sidelined, Flagg has stepped up, averaging over 31 points recently.  His increased role and performance are crucial for the Mavericks as they face a young Spurs team led by Wembanyama and Fox.

title: Rs 3,200 crore stuck in Northeast projects; Assam tops unpaid list
content: State-wise figures show Assam topping the list with Rs 1,012.87 crore pending across 35 projects, followed by Manipur (Rs 441.38 crore), Nagaland (Rs 406.09 crore) and Arunachal Pradesh (Rs 395.37 crore). Other states with large unpaid amounts include Tripura (Rs 308.71 crore), Mizoram (Rs 275.81 crore), Meghalaya (Rs 258.05 crore) and Sikkim (Rs 107.90 crore).

title: Joint statement on US trade deal soon, pact may be signed mid-March: Goyal
content: ‚ÄãTheir tariffs are executive tariffs. Our tariffs are MFN tariffs (rates applicable to countries with which concessional or FTA rates have not been worked out). So MFN tariff reduction can only take place after the legal agreement is signed, but we hope to do it fast,‚Äù commerce secretary Rajesh Agrawal said.

title: Critical minerals cooperation with US advancing rapidly: Jaishankar
content: According to the MEA, Jaishankar, in the meeting, highlighted the challenges of excessive concentration and the importance of de-risking supply, and also spoke about structured international cooperation. Jaishankar said on X that the deal opens up a new phase in India-US bilateral ties, with vast possibilities for the relationship, signalling renewed high-level engagements in the next few months.

title: Didi‚Äôs poll sop: Stipend for jobless youth, hike in payout to women
content: Finance minister Chandrima Bhattacharya on Thursday had some cheer for state govt employees too, budgeting for a 4% hike in DA. Govt rechristened its Karmashree scheme as ‚ÄúMahatma Shree‚Äù and hiked the minimum number of workdays from 75 to 100 in what is being seen as a nod to Trinamool Congress‚Äôs opposition to the Centre‚Äôs decision to replace MGNREGA.

title: Manipur erupts over Nemcha Kipgen as new deputy CM
content: ‚Äã‚ÄãThe influential Kuki Zo Council declared a social boycott of any legislator from the community joining CM Yumnam Khemchand Singh‚Äôs govt. Protesters burned tyres and blocked roads in Kangpokpi district, and at least one group called for a shutdown in the hills. In Kangpokpi, roads littered with burning tyres signalled a return to unrest after a period of relative calm across the hills.

title: 16 killed in blast at illegal coal mine in Meghalaya
content: ‚ÄãPM Narendra Modi condoled the loss of lives in the the mishap and announced an ex gratia of Rs 2 lakh from PMNRF for the next of kin of each deceased and Rs 50,000 to the injured. According to a PTI report, DGP I Nongrang has confirmed recovery of 16 bodies so far. ‚ÄúThe exact number of labourers present inside the mine at the time of the explosion is yet to be ascertained. More people are feared trapped,‚Äù she said.

title: Treat Chinese manjha deaths as murder, CM Yogi orders officials
content: Asked how the directive will be implemented, additional chief secretary (home) Sanjay Prasad said, ‚ÄúWe are working on a legal and procedural framework to ensure any death caused due to the use of banned Chinese manjha is treated as a case of murder. Clear instructions will be issued to the police so that strict action can be taken against all those involved in its sale, supply or use.‚Äù

title: Unlike in 3 other opposition states, West Bengal sees governor-govt cordiality
content: West Bengal governor CV Ananda Bose  read out portions of the address highlighting law and order, including references to Kolkata being among the safest cities in the country. In a rare display of cordiality, he was even seen briefly holding hands and speaking with CM Mamata Banerjee after his address, prompting BJP legislators to sarcastically comment ‚Äúwell done‚Äù, as he exited the House.

title: NCLT recalls order awarding Alchemist to ‚Äòsister concern‚Äô
content: The withdrawal of the corporate resolution order by NCLT, a rare occurrence, happened after Enforcement Directorate approached the Delhi bench with evidence of money laundering by the group and how the promoters had allegedly created a front entity with ‚Äúproceeds of crime‚Äù, making it a financial creditor with 97% voting rights to grab the firm under insolvency proceedings.

title: Autonomy pact inked for 6 Nagaland districts
content: As part of the arrangement, there will be devolution of powers relating to 46 subjects to FNTA, which will cover the districts of Tuensang, Mon, Kiphire, Longleng, Noklak and Shamator. The autonomy and greater say will address the long-standing grievances of ENPO over lack of equitable development in eastern Nagaland districts.

title: Fearing ‚Äòunpleasant act‚Äô by oppn, asked PM to skip Lok Sabha: Birla
content: ‚ÄúHad such an unpleasant act happened, then its sight would have torn the country‚Äôs democratic traditions to shreds,‚Äù Om Birla said amid protests from opposition MPs. PM Modi‚Äôs scheduled reply to the Motion of Thanks on the President‚Äôs address was called off at last minute on Wednesday due to intense protest from opposition MPs.

title: CPWD bought 405 air purifiers in 4 years, for babus & courts
content: In a written reply, housing and urban affairs ministry said during 2023‚Äì24 and 2024‚Äì25, CPWD procured 300 air purifiers. ‚ÄúThe devices were issued to offices, chambers, VVIP lounges, dining halls of judges and registrar of SC, courtrooms, ministers, Constitution Club of India, LS/RS secretariats in Parliament complex and various offices of ministries, departments at Nirman Bhavan, Sewa Bhavan, Vigyan Bhavan, and CPWD offices at Jodhpur and Varanasi,‚Äù it said.

title: LIC eyes higher yields from real estate
content: Addressing a press conference after the board meeting, the corporation‚Äôs MD & CEO R Doraiswamy said LIC has decided to go slow on its earlier announced plan of entering the health insurance business, which was announced by his predecessor. For the quarter ended Dec 2025, the corporation reported standalone net profit of Rs 12,958 crore, up 17.2% from Rs 11,056 crore in the corresponding year-ago period.

title: Teacher who reached out to never-been-to-school kids honoured with $1m global prize
content: Global Teacher Prize 2026 was presented at World Governments Summit in Dubai, an annual gathering of leaders and policymakers. Now in its tenth year, the prize ‚Äî an initiative of Varkey Foundation along with Unesco ‚Äî honours teachers whose work reshaped learning outcomes and communities. Nagi, who has developed pedagogy around art, began her work in the slums of Mumbai about a decade ago.

title: "What Do We Do With Shaadi.com?" Irked Top Court In Matrimonial Dispute Case
content: The Supreme Court while hearing a case involving matrimonial discord today, expressed concern about the online platform Shaadi.com.

title: Meet 'Dark Prince' Tarique Rahman, Likely Frontrunner For Bangladesh PM Post
content: Tarique Rahman is the son of former Bangladesh President Ziaur Rahman and three-time Prime Minister Khaleda Zia.

title: Arunachal Cop Mauled To Death By Tiger While Riding Bike
content: A police constable was mauled to death by a tiger while riding his motorcycle in Arunachal Pradesh's Lower Dibang Valley district on Monday.

title: As US Trade Deal Enters Final Stretch, Centre Assures Silver Lining For Farmers
content: Union Minister for Agriculture and Farmers' Welfare Shivraj Singh Chouhan firmly rejected opposition allegations that the proposed India-US trade deal could harm domestic farmers.

title: Court Rejects Actor Rajpal Yadav's Plea To Recall Surrender Order In Cheque Bounce Case
content: The Delhi High Court refused to recall its direction to actor Rajpal Yadav to surrender before jail authorities in connection with his conviction in cheque bounce cases, saying it cannot be expected to "create special circumstances".

title: Saudi To Oman: 6 Gulf Nations India Could Soon Sign Free Trade Pacts With
content: India and the six-nation bloc of Middle Eastern nations, the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC), inked terms of reference on Thursday for formally launching negotiations for a free trade agreement (FTA).

title: Pakistan's 'Kashmir Solidarity Day' Backfires With Protests Exposing Terror Links
content: Pakistan's annual attempt to project itself as a champion of Kashmir collapsed into an international embarrassment after Kashmiris and Pakistani dissidents across Europe denounced Islamabad's so-called "Kashmir Solidarity Day" as propaganda.

title: "India-US Deal In Final Stages, Will Open New Phase In Ties": S Jaishankar
content: The "historic" India-US trade agreement is in the final stages of detailing that will be completed "very soon", External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said on Thursday after holding wide-ranging talks with US Secretary of State Marco Rubio.

title: Trump Urges New Nuclear Treaty After Russia Agreement Ends
content: US President Donald Trump on Thursday called for a brand new nuclear treaty after the last agreement with Russia expired, prompting fears of a new global arms race.

title: No Alliance, Congress To Go Solo In All 294 Seats Of Bengal
content: The Congress announced that it will contest independently in all the 294 Assembly constituencies in West Bengal in the forthcoming Assembly elections in the state scheduled this year, without going for any kind of seat-sharing arrangement

title: US To Invest $1.3 Billion In Pak's Insurgency-Hit Balochistan To Mine Gold
content: Pakistan has secured nearly $1.3 billion worth of commitments from the United States for a copper and gold mining project in the South Asian nation's sensitive Balochistan province.

title: Saudi Arabia Deploys Cash And Clout In Yemen After Ousting UAE
content: After pushing the United Arab Emirates out of Yemen late last year, Saudi Arabia is deploying political capital and billions of dollars in a bid to bring its southern neighbor more firmly under its control.

title: $2 Trillion Wiped Out After Bitcoin Falls To Lowest Since October 2024
content: Bitcoin plunged on Thursday, its decline accelerating amid weakening risk sentiment driven in part by volatility in precious metals and a broad selloff in tech shares.

title: All About Bangladesh Nationalist Party And How It Was Founded
content: The BNP was founded by former Bangladesh President Ziaur Rahman on September 1, 1978. The party's ideology is rooted in 'Bangladeshi Nationalism,' recognising the right of people from all walks of life, irrespective of their ethnicity, gender or race

title: Delhi To Start Double-Decker Tourist Buses For Key Heritage Sites
content: Delhi is set to offer tourists a new way to explore its most iconic landmarks. The Delhi government will roll out double-decker tourist buses later this month, connecting key heritage and cultural sites across the national capital.

title: Merchant Navy Officer On China-Bound Ship Goes Missing Near Mauritius
content: A merchant navy official from Odisha's Bhadrak district has allegedly gone missing while on duty aboard a vessel near Mauritius on February 3, prompting his family to seek urgent intervention from the Centre and the state government, officials said.

title: Epstein Wanted Enhancement Pills, Had Low Testosterone: Medical Records
content: Recently disclosed files from the US Department of Justice shed new light on Jeffrey Epstein's health history, revealing persistent hormonal deficiencies and past sexually transmitted infections, according to medical records.

title: Pariksha Pe Charcha 2026: PM Modi To Address Students At 10 AM Today
content: PM Modi will engage with students across India in the annual 'Pariksha Pe Charcha' (PPC) event on Friday at 10 AM. The 2026 edition will focus on helping students remain stress-free during examinations and encouraging a stronger emphasis on learning.

title: Iran's Supreme Leader "Should Be Very Worried": Trump Ahead Of Oman Talks
content: US President Donald Trump delivered a forceful warning to Iran's top leadership this week, saying Iran's supreme leader "should be very worried" as the two countries prepare for resumed nuclear negotiations.

title: Rajasthan Thieves Lift Woman, 90, Along With Cot To Loot Silver Jewellery
content: Amid a sharp rise in silver prices, a shocking incident has been reported from Kothia village in the Arwad area of Bhilwara district, where thieves abducted a 90-year-old woman along with her cot in an attempt to rob her of 1.5 kg of silver jewellery

title: Transfer rumors, news: Bar√ßa, Madrid linked with Tottenham's Romero
content: Cristian Romero is attracting interest from Barcelona and real madrid . the 27-year-old is reportedly growing frustrated over Spurs' recruitment strategy . he hinted at the north London club's lack of squad depth on twitter .

content: quarterback Drew Brees is one of two quarterbacks to throw for more than 80,000 yards . wide receiver Larry Fitzgerald will also be in the 2026 Hall class . he finished second only to Hall of Famer Jerry Rice in career receptions .

title: Who makes Mike Macdonald's defense so good? Seahawks to watch in Super Bowl LX
content: the seahawks are on a more impressive Super Bowl run than the Patriots . the Seahawks have held opponents to 10 points or fewer five times . it's the biggest reason the Seattles won a club-record 14 games during the regular season .
